summary: The Caregivers, Access, and Responsible Expansion for Kids Act of 2025 (CARE for Kids Act of 2025) aims to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. The bill focuses on enhancing direct certification for school lunch programs, including children in foster care, those receiving adoption or kinship assistance, and children of families in low-income housing with caregiver grandparents. It extends eligibility for transferred students and expands automatic eligibility for programs. Finally, it modifies Medicaid direct certification rules for eligible children.
